Reviews.Title: A great little camera that blows you away!
Reviews.Author: The Big RG
Reviews.Content: I needed a new digital camera fast in order to beat the deadline for an online video contest recently.  Previously I had owned the Kodak EasyShare Z1275 model which cost me just under $200 three years ago.  Money was tight and so I didn't want to spend that kind of cash.  So I decided between two models: this one and another Kodak EasyShare listed at $104.  In the end I went with this model, the C142 and I shudder to think if I hadn't.This little camera with the small price just blew me away.  Not only does it take high quality video but the pictures are even better than my old Kodak $200 model!  I wasn't expecting that.  The photos this camera takes are absolutely gorgeous!  Even if you take a shot of your garbage can the picture is gorgeous!!The camera takes double AA batteries, has a thingie on the bottom for mounting a tripod on, a beautiful LCD screen to view your pictures and video with, a slot for an SD card, a flash, a self-timer that goes up to 10 seconds, auto focus, a review of all your shots, and best of all a feature that allows you to easily share/transfer your pictures and videos to YouTube and other social networking sites (Facebook I think).  Email as well I believe.  On screen directions are in various languages when you first turn your camera on, there's a time and date stamp, and much more.When you're ready to transfer your photos and videos to your computer all you do is plug  it in using the USB cable/plug that comes with it and instantly the software appears on your screen for use.  There is no software disc included -- it's already in the camera every time you transfer.  An important note.  You will need QuickTime to view your videos after they're transfered.  And, yes, sound is included on your video but only available on playback.  The camera has no speaker.  Volume is adjustable but I find it to be just right.  Great sound!How Kodak can afford to put out a digital camera like this with such a small price tag is beyond me.  But I have one and that's all that matters. I got the blue color and it looks like a much more expensive camera.I wish I could afford to buy another one as I would just give it away to my favorite person.  You won't be disappointed with this baby.  I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!!!!
Reviews.Author: book luvin' sistergirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take pictures at the family reunion that took place over the weekend. I was in a hurry for a new camera, my old one still worked, but I knew that there was more to be had with the new digital cameras, so I ran to my favorite online store Amazon and took a look at the cameras that were available for under $100 dollars there were so many I had to rethink price and go for a name brand and Kodak is always one that comes to mind because it has been around for so long.  I choose the C142 because the price and the ability to put in on facebook right away. It has been a great purchase the pictures come out clear, even when I was talking, walking, eating and taking pictures at the same time. You can never say that I can't multitask, I had no trouble with getting the pictures that I was trying to take and uploading them was a breeze.  If you are looking for a good camera try this one. I think you will be pleasantly surprised by the user friendly features of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: La Yoyis
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera two monts ago for our 11 year old son who right now is pretty much into LEGO stop motion movies. He is more than happy with it and the excitement hasn't worn out like it would had happened with a toy. The camera really does all what long description given at Amazon says but only when used in ideal-normal conditions like a sunny day. In this conditions, the pictures are exceptionally good for the low price. However, the functions of the camera are limited. For example, we were in a restaurant and there was enough illumination to take the picutres without flash but incandecent light made the pictures look orange. Every camera I know has a fuction to compensate this but this camera simply doesn't have it. For my kid, this camera is excellent but I wouldn't use it as my family camera.

Reviews.Title: The Kodak C142 Digital Camera (blue)
Reviews.Author: David J. Shivers "CameraCapers"
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer. There are times that I don't want to lug my DSLR around with me. I wanted a small point-and-shoot camera with features I actually need and will use. The Kodak C142 is perfect.The Smart Capture mode makes taking great pictures every time a reality.  Open the box, pop in the batteries and memory card (not supplied with the camera) turn it on and click away.I tried to "fool" the camera with tricky situations, it has never failed. From 6 inches to infinity, this camera takes tack-sharp pictures you will be proud to share! Sharing has never been easier.  You can send pictures or video directly from the camera to many different applications such as flickr, Kodak Gallery, facebook and YouTube very easily. You can even set the camera to send email by typing in email addresses on the screen with the multifunction buttons.  Take a picture, want to send it to facebook, while reviewing the picture press "share" and choose facebook. All the rest is done for you automatically when you link the camera to your computer.Even setting the time on the camera is done automatically when you link the camera to your computer.  Kodak has done it right with the C142!Who would I recommend this camera for?  Everyone, young adults, technology challenged people, people who want great pictures with no fuss, and advanced photographers who want more control over the picture taking process.  The auto focus is spectacular! I framed my dog in the focus area, as she walked around in the frame, the focus area followed her...  another perfect shot!If you are thinking about buying a camera and this model is in the running... buy it!  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera with great details
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love how this camera has the smart focus and the smart caption... it also has great blur reduction... I've never gotten clearer action shots with any other camera... and the easyshare button is a great convenience... there's several scene selections for every possible situation... my only issue with this camera is the wait time between taking pictures... it takes about 5 secs for the camera to refocus btwn pictures... oh and be sure u get the usb cord that is designed for this camera because u can't use a standard usb cord with this particular camera. If someone were to ask me if this camera was worth my money I would say definitely worth it and maybe more... photography is one of my greatest hobbies and I have a 5 yr old I can never get enough pictures of and yes I absolutely do love this camera... it's also lightweight and fits snuggly in my purse without taking up a ton of space.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product, Outstanding Price!!
Reviews.Author: K MavAZ
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product last week at a famous "Diehard" walk-in store, going back today to price match Amazon's price, its the lowest I have seen and I have done hours of research on this!!!You will love this camera for the price and the quality is superior. The big beautiful LCD screen makes picture previews flawless. Comes with numerous "scene" settings so you can create the perfect picture you are looking for. Purchased the rechargeable Lithium batteries and charger and battery usage so far has been minimal. All you need to do next is pick out a great carrying case to compliment this outstanding purchase.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY IT
Reviews.Author: Alm
Reviews.Content: Two Kodaks in two years....they do not last and do not work well. The pictures are grainy, the camera worked slow. This one did not even last a year. Just another disposable camera.

Reviews.Title: Camara review
Reviews.Author: Alatoic01
Reviews.Content: I just buy this camera for my mother birthday, I wanted something good and easy to use. I check several cameras and review the info. the Kodak EasyShare C142 seems like the best option, its not expensive, quite easy to use and have lots of options and functions, take great pictures, have not tested the video yet but I am sure will be also good, its quite small and light, the only thing I will have preferred is that it will have included the manual printed, but that is just because I prefer to read instructions in paper than in the computer. I highly recomend this model for an easy to use and inexpensive camera with good resolution.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Monique Powell
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a month now and I'm mostly happy with it. It takes good pictures. The only fault I've found with it is battery life. Duracells will give you a decent run, but 'weaker' batteries will give you as little as two photographs before they die.

Reviews.Title: Broke, returned, broke again
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for a couple days, then suddenly wouldn't turn on anymore.  I thought perhaps this was because I accidentally opened the battery compartment while the camera was still on.  Sent it back to Kodak for repairs.  When it came back it worked for another week or so, then one day while in the middle of using it the thing it shut off and never powered on again, even with new batteries.  I guess I could send it back for repairs again, or I could just throw it in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Leigh A. Moss
Reviews.Content: I think it's a good camera for the price. These type of cameras that take AA batteries really go through them, and you usually have to use only good name brand batteries. Can't get to far away from your subject, it will get blurry. But again, for the money, I think it's fine. I didn't expect a high tech super duper camera. I hoped for something I can take with my family to capture pictures of our child. This works great for that. It's excatly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Nifty Camera.
Reviews.Author: JennaLee
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over 6 months now. I have gone on a few trips with it,and it has proven to be a decent camera. I only have a few complaints.  First one that annoys me the most is the fact that there is no option to keep the date on all the time,you have to do it one by one after you take the photo! The video quality is really bad in some conditions. If you don't have a ton of light it becomes very grainy. The camera does lock up,especially when the battery life is running out. I also found out the camera goes hay-wire if you put cheap batteries in it. Literally it changed the colour of the photos,made them yellow. Also it started to refuse taking photos. :( But there are some good qualities about this camera. It is a decent camera for around 70 dollars. If you like to take pictures of flowers or plant life this is the camera for you! It comes out beautifully. Also photos of my cats come out wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Bad Choice
Reviews.Author: Hugh H. Anthony
Reviews.Content: This camera never functioned properly and eventually had to be returned. However, I have been unable to get any feedback about my return. Some feedback would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Grandma
Reviews.Author: Gay Chadwick
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson for Xmas. He loves it and takes photos all the time (thus leavimg my camera alone). The price is good and the ease of using it is excellant.

Reviews.Title: Made our grandson soooooo happy
Reviews.Author: Beverly A. Harrell
Reviews.Content: Never saw our grandson as excited over anything.  He's so thrilled to have this camera.

Reviews.Title: great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Janet L. Goodwin
Reviews.Content: First time buyer of digital camera.  The shots are clear and the process of loading onto the computer couldn't be simpler.  Gradually coming into the technology of this century.  Slow learner but this is a no brainer.  Good investment for our limited technology family.

Reviews.Title: Epic Fail
Reviews.Author: Diabolicalgirl "Brandy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom as a gift thinking that Kodak was a good product, boy was I wrong.  She used it only a few times, maybe twenty or so pictures & it stopped working completely. It won't even turn on. Thought it might be a battery issue-nope, it's a piece of crap issue. What a suck-y birthday gift for my mom this turned out to be, a total embarrassment for me & a massive disappointment for her!Epic Failure Kodak.

Reviews.Title: after a long wait, product arrived but was defective so returned it for a refund.
Reviews.Author: nonregla1
Reviews.Content: gotta say, Amazon made the return and refund process relatively painless, however, I had waited almost two weeks for delivery and then just went out and bought a similar camera at a local big box store for about the same.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed Consumer
Reviews.Author: M. Sheats
Reviews.Content: Boy, I tell you, that was short and very UNSWEET, bought it on the 7th, received it about a week later. It worked for a little over a week (probably would've been sooner had I used it more often, instead of taking a few pictures and putting it up.) before the darn thing powered off suddenly w/ the zoom lense stuck out like a tired dog w/ it's tongue hung out. I thought since it was Kodak it'd last for the long haul, dispate some of the reviews I'd read. A few of them said the same thing happened to them, but I thought maybe those occurances were flukes. WRONG!!!. The battery life is a joke, from day two it was showing that the battery was almost dead. I hadn't really taken more than 8 or 9 pictures at that point. So you can imagine my surprise. But still I pressed on. I noticed that you have to fiddle and fool around w/ it a bit to get a good picture. Which was fine cause once you start getting the hang of it the pictures come out pretty decient, some of them anyways. However, the memory is a joke, I could never get the video to work, and the editing takes a rocket scientist to work. It would've been nice if some instructions were included w/ the thing. But I guess they figure why bother. Save the money and time including this and just let em fiddle around w/ it till they figure it out. I hate to say it, but Kodak isn't what it used to be. My mom has one of their old cameras from wayyy back in the day. That thing can really take a licking and keep on ticking. It's been dropped, gotten wet,... you name it and it still looks new and works great. Too bad companies are all for quantity and profit over quality these days. But in all fairness, my niece has the exact same camera and from what I've heard she's not had any problems w/ hers. But If you asked me I think the fact that her's is still working is the fluke rather then the fact that mine stopped. LOL!

Reviews.Title: big dissapointment
Reviews.Author: shopper
Reviews.Content: Camera was defective, camera would turn on for a second, flash an error message" lens cap on" then shut off.Tried different batteries, didn't help. Returned for a different Easyshare camera.

Reviews.Title: Not quite what I paid for!
Reviews.Author: Grill Sgt
Reviews.Content: I received the camera quickly, I like that.  The color was a dull blue, that's okay.  I expected rechargeable battery in unit, I got replaceable batteries okay.  I did not receive the promotional items stated in the ad on site, not okay.  Without the extras, this item was not worth the price I paid.  I could have got this camera cheaper on another site!

Reviews.Title: Still using  till this very day very happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This little camera with the small price just blew me away. Not only does it take high quality video but the pictures are even better than my old Kodak $200 model! I wasn't expecting that. The photos this camera takes are absolutely gorgeous! Even if you take a shot of your garbage can the picture is gorgeous!!The camera takes double AA batteries, has a thingie on the bottom for mounting a tripod on, a beautiful LCD screen to view your pictures and video with, a slot for an SD card, a flash, a self-timer that goes up to 10 seconds, auto focus, a review of all your shots, and best of all a feature that allows you to easily share/transfer your pictures and videos to YouTube and other social networking sites (Facebook I think). Email as well I believe. On screen directions are in various languages when you first turn your camera on, there's a time and date stamp, and much more.When you're ready to transfer your photos and videos to your computer all you do is plug it in using the USB cable/plug that comes with it and instantly the software appears on your screen for use. There is no software disc included -- it's already in the camera every time you transfer. An important note. You will need QuickTime to view your videos after they're transfered. And, yes, sound is included on your video but only available on playback. The camera has no speaker. Volume is adjustable but I find it to be just right. Great sound!How Kodak can afford to put out a digital camera like this with such a small price tag is beyond me. But I have one and that's all that matters. I got the blue color and it looks like a much more expensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Rod Dom "Rod"
Reviews.Content: After three years of heavy use still giving the same great qualifiy pictures. Including low light, night, outdoors and sports events.

Reviews.Title: Decent Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Ken Schuetz
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera, fits easily in your pocket for easy access. Takes decent photos. Not our only camera, but a good second camera.

Reviews.Title: Grandson's gift, he loves it
Reviews.Author: Marilou Diamond
Reviews.Content: My 11 yr old grandson loves this camera and says it's easy to operate and take along on trips, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: C. E. Gerber
Reviews.Content: Have had this now for a while.  It has certainly seen a few drops and is still functioning well.  Have had some issues with getting SD cards to format for use in the camera.

Reviews.Title: 2 broken cameras
Reviews.Author: CottageDweller
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my Little Sister with BBBS, and it worked for a while until the battery door broke. Why did it break? Because the case that came with it was too tight and eventually put too much strain of the door latch. So I got a 2nd camera, this time got a case that zipped instead of using the drawstring one that was included. Within a week, it just stopped powering on. New batteries did nothing, it was just dead. Amazon was good about the return of the 2nd camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak  C142 Camera
Reviews.Author: annexab
Reviews.Content: A basic inexpensive camera that does what it should....and a nice color to boot! I have had the Kodak One Touch system before with the charging dock so the new easy share software is a liitle odd at first but I managed.

Reviews.Title: Awful product, would definitely NOT recommend
Reviews.Author: KelseyL
Reviews.Content: We received this camera as a gift for a 7 year old child.  Hasn't worked since the beginning- camera will not recognize any SD card for additional memory.  Without a memory card, the camera can only store 4 photos... yeah, even a 7 year finds that unacceptable.  We've tried 3+ brands, 3+ GB sizes, formatting, etc.  Nothing matters- this camera won't recognize any SD or SDHC card.  We even spent over 2 hours online trying to make it work, looking for firmware updates or Kodak help.  Finally decided it simply isn't worth any additional effort for this camera- we'll return and buy something that functions properly right out of the box!!

Reviews.Title: dissapointing
Reviews.Author: arpeterson
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift- very disappointed when it only worked for 10 minutes!! I had read the reviews where others had stated that it would shut off and not turn back on but since i had a Kodak of my own decided to purchase it. DON'T!! It's now on its way back to Amazon. Will not purchase another Kodak product.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after ten mins of using it
Reviews.Author: Ashish
Reviews.Content: This is the worst item i have ever bought on Amazon , it was supposed to be a gift for a younger cousin of mine so he can learn to use digital cameras before he bought a more expensive one.It was a god price for a digital camera ( now i know why) so i bought it and gifted it to my cousin, he was thrilled with it but then the next day i get a call , " Hello the piece of S%%% camera you gave me is not working"Apparently it only worked for ten mins for him to be able to take 2 - 3 pic and then it just shut off , he changed the batteries, checked all the settings (he is very tech savvy so i believe him) even changed the sd card ... NOTHING .. it just did not switch on after that.Sadly i cant even return the camera now as i had shipped the camera to my cousin to the east coast and its not worth it for me to have it shipped back and then ship it back to the seller.PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY .. DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM , i dont know if it was a one off incident or if the seller stuck me a lemon , i am out of 50 bucks and have a young cousin who thinks he has a cheap elder bro.ALSO MY ADVICE TO EVERYONE ,,,, When you buy something here ,, PLEASE TEST IT FOR A DAY OR TWO TO MAKE SURE IT WORKS BEFORE GIVING IT OUT AS A GIFT. Its far less embarrassing to have an item that looks like it's been opened once before then one that doesn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: ananda01
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  The only issue is that the autofocus sometimes gets the background instead of the face.  Otherwise the picture quality and color are good enough that I never noticed them.  The flash works right away every time, with no waiting.  My favorite thing about it is that the menus are intuitive and allow you a lot of control in just a few clicks without having to scroll a lot or waste time. It also remembers my settings. When my toddler threw it off the second floor landing and smashed it I replaced it with a Polaroid a800 because it was just a bit cheaper on sale, and it is SO TERRIBLE I have missed this one ever since and am repurchasing.  If you're looking for an affordable camera, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome digital camera
Reviews.Author: Pmm368
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few months ago because I needed a digital camera since my cell phone camera wasn't always handy in low light.  The store I bought this camera from had it on sale since it was being discontinued, the camera looked nice.  I am glad I bought it because it takes really good pictures, the camera has a macro and infinite mode, taking pictures of something up close comes out great.  The flash works really well too, if I take a picture of my room at night with the lights off, the flash lights up the whole room (and it appears that way on the picture).I have also used the video function and have to say that videos are also really good.  The audio is okay (not horrible, but not great).  Videos even come out good in low light, which I'm really happy about.Overall, I am happy with this camera and it was a good price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share
Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it takes great pictures and is really easy to use. I started having trouble with it not turning on right away and only a couple weeks after buying the camera it just wont turn on at all. I don't know if it is just the one that I got or is a typical issue.

Reviews.Title: Great camera....great seller
Reviews.Author: VadMom "VadMom"
Reviews.Content: Cute little camera that takes really good pictures.  Sent to me in just two days with standard shipping!  Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera for Casual Use
Reviews.Author: L. M. Kagan "Sequential Artist"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I keep dropping or losing my really good ones, but I like to have a camera on me whenever I go out so that I can get pictures if I need them. For serious photo people, this is not even close to the right camera to get, but I suppose it would be great for kids or vacations, since it's easy to use and takes decent pictures. There is no easy way to manually switch modes, so the camera just decides which mode you want to use automatically upon aiming the camera. Also, my nice rechargeable Kodak batteries do not fit into its battery space, which is really frustrating.However, as I said, it is a good camera for casual use such as in the case of vacationers, children, and teenagers taking pictures of themselves and their friends to put on facebook. So, this is your average camera for the average customer, but if you want to seriously work on photography and that kind of thing, I wouldn't really recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: colt
Reviews.Content: You will need an SD cardInternal memory only has room for 4 pictures.You have to watch you don't move this camera when taking pictures or they will come out blurry.For $60 it's a decent camera.Easy to upload pictures to a computer.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ranet Hughes "Msmet"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  Very easy to use.  The outside of the camera is sort of cheap though.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: M. Rentfrow "Child of Christ"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my Mother and she loves it! It is her first digital camera and it is easy for her. My only complaints are that there is no strap for the camera and the batteries that were included ran down the first day after less than 25 pictures. Hopefully the lithium batteries will last a while for her. It was delivered quickly and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: wfmarie27
Reviews.Content: I am new at using digital cameras, but I found this one easy to use.  When I had questions, they were either answered on the telephone or on the Kodak website. I am pleased with the way my pictures came out and the ease of sharing them with my family with Kodak EasyShare.  I have a Sony that cost a lot more that I could never figure out.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bobbibythelake
Reviews.Content: What a sweet little camera this is. Easy to operate for this 74 year old grandma with limited technical skills.Pictures are clear and batteries last a long time before you have to change them.I use the rechargeable ones and have a set always ready to go when the ones in the camera give out.Easy to download to your computer, even on the rechargeable batteries.Have not found anything to dislike about it as it has met all my requirements for what I wanted it for.This camera gives you options for all light conditions and distance.Great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyShare camera
Reviews.Author: Margaret Law
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mother who is in her 70's. Set up was easy and she is enjoying taking pictures of all her great grandchildrens and sharing them. Blue is her favorite color and she LOVES this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Do Not buy!
Reviews.Author: Grandma Jackie
Reviews.Content: My advice is to NOT buy this camera!  This camera was the biggest disappointment I have ever had with Amazon!  Huge disappointment!  I bought this as a gift for my grandson's birthday.  It only allows 4 pictures for internal memory - luckily I also bought the sd card.  Now it keeps shutting off and he cannot use it at all.  His birthday was June 30th.  I just found out I cannot return for a full refund as my time period elapsed June 29th.  We tried to use it last night for Fourth of July and could not even use it for one picture!  This experience has changed how I view Kodak and even Amazon.  I am a Prime Amazon member who places multiple orders every month and have almost always been happy and satisfied, but the lack of assistance on returning a defective product really makes me wonder about future purchases!  I cannot express how upset I am over this camera and worse is that it was a gift!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: PAULINE A (HAYWARD)INDIHAR-GOBLE
Reviews.Content: I just bought a Kodak C142,I previously owned an older model Kodak c330 4mpthought I would get better and not at all this new camera is hard to figure out and my screen is all fuzzy but the picture comes out ok some pictures come out blurry even tho I put it on the setting to reduce blurrinessnot  happy with it at all

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: D. O. S. Brady "babydoll86"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son's 18th birthday. He needed a camera to carry back and forth to school for his independant art class. I wanted a decent camera without the great expense in case it got damageded or lost etc. Turns out to be a great little camera. Even takes video. My son absolutely LOVES it. He is even using it for yearbook class because the schools weren't working very good. The teacher asked where he got it because she was interested in one. Overall, I would buy it again if something happens to the one he has.

Reviews.Title: not very happy
Reviews.Author: S. Helms "Hard working 50 year old"
Reviews.Content: This is not a very high quality camera. It takes a lot of work and adjustment to take good pictures. I bought it for work because theywere using 1 of my old digital Kodak cameras and was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: BIG disappointment.
Reviews.Author: janemaine
Reviews.Content: This camera lasted 2 shots/2 minutes before it decided not to work anymore. I went online w/Kodak for tech support and they told me the camera "needed service." After 2 minutes of use? Are you kidding? I have returned it and hope Amazon will be fast and furious with a refund. This was a big disappointment. Next time I will purchase something a bit more expensive (and more reliable?) with a better rating. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: sellers
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter she is very happy with it.  Battery does not last too long though.Are you ever going to pay attention to my complain about these sellers?  I want to return the extra camera that was ordered by mistake.I rate this people as the worst.  And I don't believe I'll continue shopping with you either.Carolina.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: This camera took blured fuzzy horrible pics. the second i turned it on it felt cheap. i tried workin with the settings to make it take a good picture and it didnt!!! I HATED IT. The day i got it I sent it back!!! DONT GET THIS CAMERA

Reviews.Title: KODAK DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: G. Walters
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WAS A GIFT FOR A RELATIVE, SO I HAVE NOT PERSONALLY USED IT.  I HAVE, HOWEVER, RECEIVED E-MAILED PHOTOS TAKEN WITH IT.  I WAS TOLD IT WAS FAIRLY EASY TO USE.  IT USES "AA" BATTERIES, WHICH I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND - GET A CAMERA WITH LITHIUM ION BATTERIES FOR BEST RESULTS, OR CARRY SOME EXTRA "AA's" WITH YOU.  I WILL PROBABLY BUY THIS CAMERA AGAIN FOR MY GRANDDAUGHTER, MAINLY DUE TO THE LOW PRICE.  PERSONALLY, I HAVE A SONY AND I LOVE IT, BUT I THINK THIS CAMERA HAS IT'S PLACE.

ProductInfo.Features:
10-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom
2.7-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature; Face Recognition feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare C142 10 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD (Blue)
